conclusion: Understanding the relationship between the light source, objects, and shadows.
Shadow A of the apple is cast to the left and slightly forward.
Light source is positioned to the front and slightly to the left of the apple.
Shadow B of the paper is cast to the right and slightly forward.
Light source is positioned to the front and slightly to the left of the paper.
Shadow C of the glass is cast to the left and slightly forward.
Light source is positioned to the front and slightly to the left of the glass.
Shadow D of the chicken leg is cast to the right and slightly forward.
Light source is positioned to the front and slightly to the left of the chicken leg.
Light source moves to the back right, affecting shadow direction and angle.
Shadow A of the apple will be cast to the right and slightly backward.
Shadow B of the paper will be cast to the left and slightly backward.
Shadow C of the glass will be cast to the right and slightly backward.
Shadow D of the chicken leg will be cast to the left and slightly backward.
A will move to the right and become smaller.
B will move to the left and become smaller.
C will move to the right and become smaller.
D will move to the left and become smaller.
Final answer: A moves right and becomes smaller, B moves left and becomes smaller, C moves right and becomes smaller, D moves left and becomes smaller.
